content: cat ears hat by alysia coffield this is a great project to help use up excess sock/fingering weight yarn in your stash by using two different skeins held together to give it a bit of bulk mix and match colors to give it a marbled and striped look along the way materials ● size us 3 circular 16in ● sock weight yarn - 65g total two strands are held together while knitting to make it a little thicker and if you use two different colors it also gives it a marbled look ● yarn needle to weave in ends gauge 5 stitches/inch in stockinette stitch please check your gauge my gauge always tends to be very loose and i have to size down 3 needle sizes when following someone else s gauge pattern cast on 100 stitches while holding the two different skeins together knit 1 purl 1 for 1 5 inches to create the brim once the brim is finished you will do an increase round k10 m1k and repeat all the way around increasing 10 stitches total so you now have 110 stitches on your needles now you will continue to stockinette stitch until you have 6 inches from the cast on edge decrease k10 k2tog and repeat to the end of the round knit for the next round k5 k2tog and repeat to the end of the round knit for the next round k1 k2tog and repeat to the end of the round finish by using kitchener stitch to make the seam at the top of the hat weave in your ends and wear your adorable hat proudly
